official-title.#text:
To require full funding of part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
			 and the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Keep Our Promise to America’s Children and Teachers Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Keep Our Promise to America’s Children and Teachers Act
Keep Our PACT Act

text.#text: The Congress finds as follows:
Children are our Nation’s future and greatest treasure.
A high-quality education is the surest way for every child to reach his or her full potential.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
helps address inequity in education
			 in school districts across the country to provide a high-quality education
			 to every student.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:I

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
guarantees all children with disabilities a
			 first-rate education.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Individuals with Disabilities Education Act

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
committed Congress to providing 40
			 percent of the national current average per-pupil expenditure for students
			 with disabilities.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Individuals with Disabilities Education Improvement Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Individuals with Disabilities Education Improvement Act

text.#text: The
A promise made must be a promise kept.

header.#text: Full funding of part A of title I of ESEA

header.#text: Mandatory funding of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act

$37,231,164,000 or 40 percent of the amount determined under

text.#text:
shall become available for obligation with respect to fiscal year 2024 on July 1, 2024, and shall
			 remain available through September 30, 2025; and

shall become available for obligation with respect to each subsequent fiscal year on July 1 of that
			 fiscal year and shall remain available through September 30 of the
			 succeeding fiscal year.

With respect to each subparagraph of paragraph (1), the amount determined under this paragraph is
			 the product of—
the total number of children with disabilities in all States who—

received special education and related services during the last school year that concluded before
			 the first day of the fiscal year for which the determination is made; and
were aged—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Individuals with Disabilities Education Act/s:619

text.#text: 3 through 5 (with respect to the States that were eligible for grants under
6 through 21; and

the average per-pupil expenditure in public elementary schools and secondary schools in the United
			 States.

The amounts appropriated by this Act and the amendments made by this Act shall be expended
			 consistent with pay-as-you-go requirements.
